intro: Procris obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leafed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Procris obtusa is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky slopes.
